Job description

ABOUT THE ROLE


As a Mr & Mrs Jones Store Manager, your role is to manage all aspects of the store and take responsibility for achieving sales targets and operational goals.


You will have a strong focus on customer service, inspiring and leading the team to achieve exceptional results, maintaining store visual standards and managing stock control.


You must know the importance of training, empowering and coaching your Team.


As a Store Manager at Mr & Mrs Jones you:


  • Value relationships with our team members and our customers. You are a strong leader and a key team player.
  • Are passionate about making others happy; it’s what gets you out of bed in the morning.
  • Love bringing joy to people’s lives. You appreciate the importance of the little things.
  • Share the same thoughtfulness with our gift-giving customers. You put our customer first and go out of your way to make them feel serviced, satisfied and a little bit special.


You will lead your Team in:


  • Providing impeccable, personalised, genuine customer service.
  • Achieving and exceeding store sales targets and KPI targets.
  • Managing rosters in line with our budgets.
  • Ensuring Mr & Mrs Jones brand purpose, promise & values are at the core of every decision made
  • Maintaining all training and team development.
  • Managing stock control and inventory.

\xa0

If you’re a thoughtful gift enthusiast, apply now—we’d love for you to join our Mr & Mrs Jones family.

Senior Account Executive

Company Name Auror Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 66 views

Job description

As the Senior Account Executive you will be responsible for driving new business growth across Australia, along with managing complex sales cycles and presenting, to C-level executives, the value of Auror.\xa0


You’ll have finely tuned analytical skills and the ability to develop clear and agreed upon plans with current and future prospects is incredibly important. Follow through is important to you and you pride yourself on the relationships you build throughout the sales process.
You have a good ability to understand where things are sitting with prospects/customers throughout the sales process and can accurately forecast sales activity to overachievement assigned revenue quota.


You will be responsible for:


  • Identifying potential customers and set approach strategies
  • Developing strong and long-term client relationships
  • Selling across Executive level and across different LOB decision makers that include IT, HR, Marketing, Engineering etc.)
  • Clearly articulating and demonstrating the value of Auror to qualified prospects and working on a mutual plan to bring them to closed-won
  • Expanding relationships with current enterprise clients, while leveraging your business knowledge, to expand and even upgrade the Auror offering throughout their organization(s).
  • Achieving quota and driving performance to exceed quota
  • Maintaining a healthy pipeline within Hubspot with good history of account activity and contact engagement.
  • Presenting to potential prospects, customers, and strategic partners on the value of Auror
  • Developing detailed sales analysis and plan for each deal in your pipeline & effectively sharing progress reports back to Auror


REQUIREMENTS

  • 5+ years of quota carrying enterprise sales experience to large, complex organizations
  • Track record of over achieving quota in past positions
  • Strong strategic presentation skills
  • Possess a hungry, motivated, high energy, and enthusiastic spirit
  • Excellent written and verbal communication and active listening skills
  • Willingness to travel for regular customer meetings and events
  • Network effectively with local clients and develop strong professional relationships
  • Business acumen with a problem-solving attitude
  • Ability to collaborate & resourceful
  • Strong understanding of sales fundamentals & drive for results
  • Ability to work in fast-paced, team environment
  • Strong analytical and negotiation skills
  • Challenger selling experience

Marketing Specialist

Company Name AHS Hospitality - a Chandler Macleod Group Business Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 96 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • A position which challenges your thinking and encourages your creativity
  • Be an integral part of our marketing team
  • Drive brand awareness across two business units


Are you looking for your next opportunity, which challenges your thinking and encourages your creativity where no two days or projects are the same?


This is your chance to join the Chandler Macleod group, working across two of it’s business units -\xa0AHS Hospitality and Vivir Healthcare as our Marketing Specialist, reporting directly to both Executive General Managers.


Supporting the AHS & Vivir teams in Digital and Design you’ll be at the heart of building the visual brand for the two businesses and you’ll be able to turn your hand to a multitude of tasks from producing collateral in design templates to coordinating our online brand hub for our full brand family, from drafting content to coordinating web projects and providing high quality and timely graphic design solutions.


Key responsibilities include:

  • Designing and producing marketing materials (including copywriting)
  • Graphic design support for tenders and client presentations
  • Graphic design support for internal communications
  • Graphic design support for website, eDM, digital advertising and social media activities as required
  • Producing finished art from layout designs
  • Following style sheets and brand guidelines to provide sales collateral
  • Writing content, liaising with external agencies, creating digital assets, and conducting social media activities to ensure our primary social media pages are constantly active
  • Project coordination of large design/production jobs such as ebooks and white papers, including day to day task management of the team’s design activities


About you:

  • Strong understanding of design and general marketing principles and their role in a commercial enterprise
  • Strong knowledge of Adobe creative suite CC, InDesign, Microsoft Word and PowerPoint
  • Creative skills in the conceptualization and execution of high quality, professional design for a broad range of marketing, sales and operational executions
  • Digital savvy with a genuine interest in latest trends within commercial design
  • Strong level of attention to detail for proof reading and design review
  • Ability to maintain up to date, practical and accurate library of design materials
  • Strong relationship management and interpersonal skills – demonstrated customer service skills
  • Excellent time management skills and ability to multi-task and work under pressure


Apply today!
For a confidential discussion, please don't hesitate to contact Elisa Midolo HR Specialist at elisa@vivir.com.au or on (03) 8629 2607

864927030:
[

Principal Advisor to the Chief Judge

Company Name Fisher Leadership (formerly Jo Fisher Executive) Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 50 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Advise the Chief Judge on the strategic and operational management of the County Court
  • A unique opportunity to help lead a progressive Victorian Court
  • Challenging work across the Court’s broad jurisdiction


The Position


The Principal Advisor to the Chief Judge is a career-shaping opportunity to work alongside Chief Judge Peter Kidd in a high-level advisory capacity. The County Court is Victoria’s busiest trial court and the position is critical to the management of the Court and supports the Chief Judge’s role as a member of Courts Council and as a Justice of the Supreme Court.


As a representative of the Chief Judge and working closely with the Chief Executive Officer of the Court, the appointee will display leadership qualities and liaise with the Judiciary and a broad range of stakeholders throughout the justice system. The Principal Advisor will support the Chief Judge in his role by researching, developing and implementing strategies, by managing complex and sensitive projects, and by managing the administrative workflow of Chambers.


As a member of the Court’s Executive Leadership Team the appointee will have a strategic view of the Victoria’s courts system and have a strong track record in advisory, policy and strategic management capacities. The appointee will have exceptional communication and conceptual skills and must display integrity, decisiveness, and creative problem-solving ability. An undergraduate qualification in an aligned discipline is mandatory and a post graduate qualification in the same is highly desirable. A tertiary qualification in Law will be highly regarded.


The Organisation


The County Court of Victoria has original and appellate jurisdiction and is the principal trial court in the State of Victoria.


The Court hears over 11,000 criminal, common law and commercial cases each year.

With a total of 65 Judges of the Court and over 200 staff, including judicial support staff, the County Court regularly conducts circuit sittings at 12 circuit courts situated in major centres throughout regional Victoria.


For more information visit: www.countycourt.vic.gov.au


To apply\xa0– please click on ‘APPLY ONLINE’ using reference CCOpcj0918, addressing your cover letter and resume to David Baber, of Fisher Leadership, or call +61 1300 347 437 for further information.

Lawyer, Employment

Company Name Kennedys Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 51 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Kennedys is looking to recruit a Senior Associate/Lawyer into our Employment team in our Melbourne office.


The role will be assisting the Melbourne employment team, working on an exciting mix of industrial relations, health and safety, discrimination and employment law matters, covering both litigation and advisory services.


We are looking for candidates who are team players, who can develop and maintain excellent client relationships and who are keen to be involved in marketing/business development and client training activities.


Type of cases:


  • Mainly respondent employment claims ranging in value and complexity covering the full range of employment disputes. The vast majority are litigated in the Fair Work Commission and Federal Courts.
  • Advisory matters ranging from day-to-day ad hoc advice to client HR teams and contract and policy drafting.


Requirements:


  • 5 years’+ experience, with workplace relations’ experience
  • Knowledge and understanding of Australian employment law
  • Experience and knowledge of Fair Work Commission and Federal Court processes and procedures
  • Non-contentious employment experience
  • Running own caseload

865153683:
[

Project Manager (Power Systems)

Company Name Clean Technology Partners Pty Ltd Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 146 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Clean Technology Partners is an independent engineering consultancy specialising in solar PV projects. We have worked on a wide range of systems from multi-megawatt solar farms to medium scale projects. We provide electrical, mechanical and structural engineering design services for PV projects. The Power Systems Project Manager will\xa0get to work in the fastest pace industry in Australia, surrounded by a positive team passionate about renewables.\xa0\xa0


Purpose of the position:


The purpose of this position is to be the client interface role for Power Systems projects in
addition to providing power systems engineering expertise.

The role will involve contact with CTP clients, sub-contractors and relevant project teams to
ensure that CTP meets its contracted obligations. The successful candidate should display
a high level of initiative and problem solving ability to satisfy internal and external clients’
demands in an efficient manner.

This role is an intermediate/senior role within the Utility team with the aim of the Project
Manager developing into a full-time project management role.


Responsibilities:


  • Manage and deliver projects for CTP’s utility scale client’s. Key responsibilities include:
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0- Clear understanding of project scope, timelines, budgets, deliverables and risks
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0- Prepare and maintain project schedules and budgets / cost controls
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0- Assign project resources, manage and motivate CTP engineering and support staff
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0- Attend client meetings, site visits etc as required
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0- Develop understanding of technical portions of CTP’s work
  • Project Manager will be point of contact for CTP clients and shall conduct
  • him/herself in a professional manner at all times
  • Creating and improving CTP standard documentation and processes
  • Project Manager must manage their time resources and participate in resource
  • planning meetings. It is essential that the Project Manager meets all committed
  • timelines/deadlines for CTP clients
  • Project Manager must ensure that invoicing is done on-time and accurately and is
  • required to attend monthly invoicing meetings
  • Assisting the utility scale engineering team with obtaining information for power
  • system modelling for grid connections in-line with current Australian Standards,
  • National Electricity Rules and best practice. This includes :
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0- System concept design (Primary & Secondary Design)
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0- Power system modelling (PowerFactory & PSS/E)
  • Steady-State Analysis (Load Flow / Short Circuit Studies)
  • Dynamic Analysis (Transient Response / Control System Analysis)
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0- Preparation of DNSP Grid Connection application documents and technical reports
\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0- Interface with product suppliers for technical information
  • Providing assistance where required on a range of CTP products and solutions
  • including specification of equipment and power system design
  • Creating and maintaining CTP standard documentation and engineering system
  • tools (spreadsheets, standard documents and processes, etc)
  • Project Manager must have excellent time management skills. It is essential that the Project Manager meets all committed timelines/deadlines for CTP clients
  • Other duties as required from time to time


Skills Required - Critical


  • Inspired and motivated to work in renewable energy sector
  • Professional communication skills
  • Schedule and budget management of multiple projects at once
  • Logical problem solver and decision maker. Must be solution driven
  • Understanding of Electricity Distribution/Transmission Systems and Power System Software (PowerFactory, PSS/E &/or PSCAD)
  • Ability to interpret power system modelling results
  • Ability to communicate clearly and good written English skills are critical
  • Firm understanding of medium voltage systems
  • Firm understanding of electrical design and systems.
  • Ability to read and produce electrical SLDs (LV / MV / HV)
  • Familiar with AS/NZS 3000, AS/NZS 3008, AS 2067
  • Ability to make electrical design decisions and recommendations under
    difficult circumstances
  • Degree qualification in electrical engineering with at least 5 years work experience

Skills Required – Desired


  • Previous experience in a Network Service Provider (NSP) is highly advantageous
  • Detailed understanding of Solar PV and / or Inverter Energy Systems (ie Power Electronics)
  • Skilled at Technical and Economic Assessment
  • Capable of reviewing and interpreting control and communication designs
  • Masters qualification in engineering / project management


We offer many benefits to ensure your professional development & wellbeing:


  • Professional and technical development opportunities
  • Young and diverse environment
  • Hands on and reactive team
  • Open, honest, positive and future-focused communication
  • Socially responsible employer: pro bono work, community development, sustainable sourcing and more
  • Flexible working arrangement
  • Modern offices
  • And more: free weekly sport training, premium coffee, Friday drinks, ...


Application Details:


  • Apply to\xa0careers@clean-tech.com.au with your CV and cover letter, mentionning the role title

Senior IoT Systems Engineer

Company Name Operational Technology Solutions Pty Ltd Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 66 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Senior IoT Systems Engineer

\xa0

OTS is a leader in IoT solutions for the utility industry, recent customer demand means that we must accelerate our development roadmap. We're looking for a Senior IoT Systems Engineer who will report to the CTO and will lead the engineering and delivery of our IoT products, this is a hands on engineering role with an opportunity to build and lead an engineering team in the future. The right person has a relevant bachelors degree in engineering, and extensive experience in embedded systems engineering - they'll not only be a master of C in embedded systems but be capable of designing new solutions from concept to delivery.

\xa0

Other experience that would be well regarded include:

\xa0

- Experience developing solutions for Low Power WAN technologies, e.g. LTE CatM1, NB-IoT or mesh radio networks,

- CoAP, DTLS, and LWM2M protocols,

- Modern application development processes, continuous integration and automated testing.

- Electronics engineering, from hardware testing and diagnostics to circuit design and layout

- Product manufacturing, i.e. selecting and managing suppliers

- Utilities industry experience, e.g. SCADA networks and traditional Machine to Machine communications.

\xa0

This is a unique opportunity for the right person to shape our IoT product engineering and disrupt a traditionally conservative industry with new ways of doing things.


Please send your current resume with your application.\xa0


Must already have the right to work in Australia.\xa0
